thread.title: Sabers coming of age under pressure
thread.title_full: Sabers coming of age under pressure

title: Sabers coming of age under pressure
text:
Sabers coming of age under pressure 
By wbng sports October 4, 2015 Updated Oct 4, 2015 at 9:56 PM EDT 
Conklin, NY (WBNG Binghamton) You may as well call them the last-second Sabers. Three Susquehanna Valley's five games this season have been down to the wire: first an overtime loss in Windsor, then a 1-point win over Norwich -- but Saturday's effort was arguably the best. 
Cameron Manchester scored with 3.9 seconds to play and the ensuring extra point lifted Susquehanna Valley over Owego, 13-12. SV's roster may be filled with juniors and seniors, but a lot of those guys sat behind 2015's terrific senior class, so there's not as much experience there. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
The Sabers' head coach, however, says the Sabers are wise beyond their years when the game is on the line. 
"I think we have a very young group," said Mike Ford. "They're young, but they don't quit until the end. These close games -- sometimes with a young group, that's where you lose them, but this young group is a little bit more mature than their years maybe let on. 
With three weeks to play, the playoff race in Class B is wide open. The top four qualify for the sectional playoffs. 
Class B standings (Division Record) 1. Chenango Valley 4-1 (4-0)2. Waverly 4-1 (3-1)4. Susquehanna Valley 2-3 (2-2)5. Owego 3-2 (1-2)6. Norwich 1-4 (1-3)7. Oneonta 0-5 (0-4)
